turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Serrodes partita.
turn.1: What is known about the genus Serrodes partita?
turn.2: Serrodes partita Serrodes partita, the catapult moth, is a moth of the family Erebidae.
turn.4: The species was first described by Johan Christian Fabricius in 1775.
turn.6: It is found in western, eastern, central and southern Africa, India, Indonesia (Borneo, Java) and Sri Lanka.
turn.8: The wingspan of the adults is approximately 60 mm.
turn.9: What else is known about the genus?
turn.10: Head, thorax and forewings dark or red or greyish brown.
turn.12: Forewings with a sub-basal dark red-brown spot on the costa, with a line from its lower edge.
